citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)
citeinfo.title: Eastern Bering Sea Juvenile Salmon Surveys (By Ed Farley: AFSC Quarterly Report: Jul. - Sep. 2002)

descript.abstract: During the eastern Bering Sea survey, conducted in Bristol Bay from 18 August to 14 September, 75 trawl stations were sampled beginning at the northern end of the long. 161EW transect and ending on the southern end of the long. 166EW transect. During the northeastern Bering Sea survey (15 September to 12 October), 77 trawl stations across the shelf were sampled beginning at 58EN near Nunivak Island and ending north of St. Lawrence Island at 65EN .
descript.purpose: The primary goal of this annual surveys is to establish and verify the linkages between adult sockeye salmon survival and annual variations in biological characteristics of juvenile salmon.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
